SENT.plain: Metformin represents the cornerstone of treatment for type 2 diabetes mellitus
Traditionally, heart failure (HF) was considered a contraindication to its use
However, more recent evidence has shown that this should no longer be the case
Indeed, studies have demonstrated that metformin may even reduce the risk of incident HF and mortality in diabetic patients, while improving up to 2-year survival rates in those with HF
In addition, it appears to exert cardioprotective actions

Although longer follow-up data and more explicit information about the situation in patients with very advanced HF are needed, the cardiac safety of metformin has profound clinical implications and may be anticipated to further encourage its widespread use
